```{r load_packages, message = FALSE, warning=FALSE, include=FALSE}
library(fontawesome)

# define colors
pal1 = "#63D4FD" # pale azure
pal4 = "#AFE9FE" # non-photo blue, 20% lighter
pal6 = "#40B8E0" # 20% darker
pal2 = "#EA7E5D" # burnt sienna
pal3 = "#EC8C6F" # coral
pal5 = "#8C1721" # carmine
pal7 = "#C8504D" # bittersweet shimmer, 20% lighter than carmine

# colorize text
colorize <- function(x, color) {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output()) {
    sprintf("\\textcolor{%s}{%s}", color, x)
  } else if (knitr::is_html_output()) {
    sprintf("<span style='color: %s;'>%s</span>", color,
      x)
  } else x
}
```

## `r colorize("Bio", pal5)`
<br>
Welcome to my page! I am an incoming PhD Student at the Keck School of Medicine studying Development, Stem Cells, and Regenerative Medicine. I am highly interested in understanding the genetic regulatory networks and molecular signal pathways that drive developmental patterns, and hope to use these pathways to treat chronic disease and congenital abnormalities.

---

## `r colorize("Research", pal5)`
<br>
I currently study human kidney development in the [`r colorize("Lindstrom Lab", pal1)`](https://lindstromlab.usc.edu/), with an emphasis on the nephron (filtration unit of the kidney). I am specifically interested in the Wnt/β-catenin pathway's link to the nascent nephron's cell identities and morphogenetic features. 

I hope to leverage *in vitro*  **`r colorize("hiPSC kidney organoids", pal5)`**, **`r colorize("multi-omic sequencing", pal5)`**, and **`r colorize("high-resolution imaging", pal5)`** to create developmental blueprints for kidney organogenesis.

I am highly motivated to build off our past atlases of [`r colorize("human", pal1)`](https://sckidney.flatironinstitute.org/) and [`r colorize("mouse", pal1)`](https://cello.shinyapps.io/kidneycellexplorer/) nephrogenesis to create regenerative cell types for therapeutic discovery and renal replacement therapy.
